quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: World and Boxing
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, people, lance. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who played Bill Clinton in Austin Powers:The Spy Who Shagged Me?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tim Robbins

questions.question: Hal Holbrook toured the country in a one man show about this President. Raymond Massey, Henry Fonda and John Carradine won much fame for  playing this great man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: Pele, probably the most famous soccer player ever, retired in 1974 after having won three world championships with Brazil. He returned a few months later and joined which club?

options.text: He did not join any club, but he still played for the Brazilian national team.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Cosmos, USA

questions.question: F1 driver Michael Schumacher decided to return to the track for the 2010 season. Which team did he join?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercedes

questions.question: George Foreman returned to boxing after a 12-year break to become the oldest heavy weight champion ever. How old was he when he beat Michael Moorer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 45

questions.question: Ralph Bellamy played this President in 1960s Sunrise at Campobello and in the stage version of the same name. Edward Herrmann played him in  1982s Annie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: FDR

questions.question: Janne Ahonen, a top sportsman from Finland, retired in 2008, only to return to his sport a year later. What is his sport?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ski jumping

questions.question: Swimming champion Dara Torres retired and returned two times. Which statement about her comebacks is true?

options.text: She won 3 Olympic silver medals the first time, but failed to qualify the second time for the Beijing Olympic team.
Her first return in 2000, after giving birth, was a disaster, but the second time she won 5 medals at the Olympics in Sydney.
She won a gold medal and four other medals in Sydney (2000) and three silver medals in Beijing (2008).
Her first return, in Sydney, earned her 3 silver medals but the second time, in Beijing, she was not successful.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She won a gold medal and four other medals in Sydney (2000) and three silver medals in Beijing (2008).

questions.question: Michael Jordan returned to the NBA twice. After his first return in 1995, he led the Chicago Bulls to three titles. What statement is true about his second return in 2001?

options.text: He joined the Washington Wizzards but his team did not did not qualify for the play-offs.
He returned to the Chicago Bulls, but played mostly as a substitute.
He played for the Washington Wizzards and led them to their first title ever.
He led the Chicago Bulls to another title.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He joined the Washington Wizzards but his team did not did not qualify for the play-offs.

questions.question: Did Muhammad Ali return to boxing after his retirement in 1978?

options.text: Officially yes, but due to his Parkinsons disease he never fought again.
Yes and he lost to Larry Holmes.
Yes, he beat George Foreman in the famous fight in Kinshasa.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes and he lost to Larry Holmes.

questions.question: Kevin Kline played this hard-drinking President in 1999s Wild Wild West.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grant

questions.question: Bjorn Borg shocked the tennis world when he retired in his prime years (he was only 25 and was at the top). What did he achieve when he returned in the early 1990s?

options.text: He appeared in four Grand Slam finals, but failed to win anything.
He failed to win a single match in 10 consecutive tournaments.
He won all Grand Slam tournaments.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He failed to win a single match in 10 consecutive tournaments.

questions.question: Lance Armstrong had won 7 times the prestigious Tour de France cycling race before retiring. He returned in 2009. What result did he achieve in the Tour?

options.text: He finished 100th, with a huge gap to the winner.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He came third.

questions.question: Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean amazed the world performing to Ravels Bolero during the 1984 Olympic Games in Sarajevo. 10 years later they skated at another Olympics. Did they win another medal?

options.text: No, their comeback was a complete disaster.
They won, but were disqualified for cheating.
Yes, they performed to the same music and won gold again.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes, they won bronze.

questions.question: James Whitmore played this President in 1975s Giveem Hell Harry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Truman

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Inventor and Meaning
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, holography. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Of what origin is the very popular male name William?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old Germanic

questions.question: This American chemist is the inventor of Nylon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wallace Carothers

questions.question: What is the name of the American who patented the first artificial heart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Winchell

questions.question: Tthe male name Samuel and its derivatives Sam and Sammie all mean what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: God has heard

questions.question: What English social reformer and teacher invented the postage stamp?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rowland Hill

questions.question: What is the meaning of the popular name Rachel, derived from the Hebrew name Rahel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ewe

questions.question: This inventor received the patent for the first fountain pen on May 25, 1827.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Petrache Poenaru

questions.question: The names Sean, Shane, Shaine, Shaun, and Shawn all mean what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: God is gracious

questions.question: What is the meaning of the female name Katherine and its versions Catherine, Cathy, Kat, Kate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Purity

questions.question: What American scientist invented the computer mouse?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Douglas Engelbart

questions.question: Stainless steel, initially called rustless steel, is believed to have been invented by this man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Brearley

questions.question: What is the name of the electrical engineer who invented holography?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Gabor

questions.question: This man received the patent for inventing the first practical telephone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Graham Bell

questions.question: What German physiologist created the prototype of the modern contact lenses?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adolf Eugen Fick

questions.question: This German chemist was the first to develop stable, medically useful forms of heroin and aspirin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Felix Hoffmann

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Nobel Prize and Meaning
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is not among the categories in which the Nobel Prize is awarded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Biology

questions.question: What do the female names Eve, Evelyn, Evita, Ava, Eva, Evie all mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Living

questions.question: With the exception of the Nobel Peace Prize, the Nobel Prizes are presented at an annual ceremony in Stockholm, Sweden. In what capital city ise the Nobel Peace Prize presented?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oslo, Norway

questions.question: Of what origin is the male name Jacob and its derivatives James, Jim, Jimmy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hebrew

questions.question: What is the meaning of the very popular male name David and its derivative, Dave?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beloved

questions.question: In 1888, a newspaper in this country published an erroneous premature obituary of Alfred Nobel condemning him for his invention of dynamite.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning movie told the story of John Forbes Nash, the recipient of the 1994 Nobel Prize in Economics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Beautiful Mind

questions.question: Bertha Kinsky, Alfred Nobels secretary and housekeeper, was the first woman to win the Nobel Prize in this category.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peace

questions.question: This prize is often described as the Nobel Prize of Mathematics but unlike the Nobel Prizes it is awarded once every four years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Fields Medal

questions.question: What is the meaning of the popular female names Sarah, Sara and Sally?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Princess

questions.question: The reason why there is no Nobel Prize in Mathematics is that a mathematician had an affair with Alfred Nobels wife.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following European dictators was nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This American author, who won the Pulitzer Prize for the novel Humboldts Gift, was also awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature for the human understanding and subtle analysis of contemporary culture that are combined in his work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saul Bellow

questions.question: What is the meaning of the popular male names Richard, Riccardo, Ricky?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Powerful leader

questions.question: During the first half of the 20th century, four members of the Curie family won 5 Nobel Prizes altogether. Which one of them did not win the Nobel Prize in Chemistry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pierre Curie

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: George Washington and Explorer
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, englands, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This British officer took part in the Arab revolt against Ottoman Turkish rule of 1916–18.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Name the explorer who captained the ship Calypso from 1951 to 1996.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacques-Yves Cousteau

questions.question: George Washington was the first President to be inaugurated in two different cities.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What statement is true about British explorer Captain Sir Richard Francis Burton?

options.text: He translated One Thousand and One Nights into English.
He traveled in disguise to Mecca.
Traveled with John Hanning Speke in search of the source of the Nile.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What treaty called for British troops to give up forts in the western frontier in 1796?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jays Treaty

questions.question: How did George Washington die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: complications from a throat infection

questions.question: What year was the Whiskey Rebellion put down by George Washingtons militia force?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1794

questions.question: Which statement is true about Mata Hari?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Time magazine named this person one of the 100 most influential people of the 20th century and an Alberto Korda photograph of him was said to be the most famous photograph in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernesto Che Guevara

questions.question: She became famous as the woman who captured the heart of Englands naval hero Horatio Nelson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emma Hamilton

questions.question: Sir Francis Drake was an English pirate, sailor, and hero of many battles at sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When George Washington retired to Mount Vernon at age 65 he became reclusive seeing very few people other than Martha.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This famous Venetian adventurer and author wrote an autobiography, titled Histoire de ma vie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giacomo Casanova

questions.question: After retirement as President, George Washington was called to duty one more time as Commander in Chief of the army.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which German naturalist, explorer, and geographer introduced a new section in geography called Geography of Plants”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander von Humboldt

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Yankees and Athletics
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athletics, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In his 31-year career, this driver, nicknamed The Iceman, has won over 20 major NASCAR races.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Labonte

questions.question: He was a right-handed pitcher for the Yankees, Athletics, Indians and Mets. In 1962 he was the World Series MVP and won the Babe Ruth Award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ralph Terry

questions.question: This American actress has starred in The Conversation, Young Frankenstein, Close Encounters of  the Third Kind and Tootsie. Her career has been adversely affected by Multiple Sclerosis and a brain aneurysm.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teri Garr

questions.question: Who was the only American-born member of Monty Python?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Gilliam

questions.question: In 1954 this first baseman was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Terry

questions.question: You are stopped by a police officer while driving. He gives you a speeding ticket and then searches your  car. You protest his right to search. He then alludes to this US Supreme Court Case.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry v Ohio

questions.question: He is one of the best quarterbacks in the history of the Pittsburgh Steelers. He has also been a fairly successful actor and sports analyst.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Bradshaw

questions.question: When this Terry was only 6, she appeared in a widely popular movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The dog who played Toto

questions.question: Who was manager of the Boston Red Sox when they won their first World Series in over 90 years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Francona

questions.question: Terry Gene Bollea is a famous athlete better known by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hulk Hogan

questions.question: TERI is a private, non-profit agency that deals with this subject.

options.text: The support of  young actors and actresses
The improvement of the lives of people with autism
The improvement of the lives of retired persons

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The improvement of the lives of people with autism

questions.question: Who was the winner in Season 2 of Americas Got Talent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Fator

questions.question: This great jazz trumpeter was the only  African-American musician in the band on The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clark Terry

questions.question: In which sport was Terry Sawchuck famous?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hockey

questions.question: He was the brains behind the cartoons Mighty Mouse and Heckle and Jeckle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Terry

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Us and President
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the first US President born on the 4th of July?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calvin Coolidge

questions.question: What US President has worn a Nazi uniform?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: Which of these US Presidents did not die on July 4?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert Hoover

questions.question: When did Sharon, a Major General by rank, retire from his military career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1972

questions.question: What do these US Presidents have in common: George Washington, James Madison, Andrew Jackson, James Polk, James Buchanan and Warren Harding.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They had no children.

questions.question: Which US President loved to cook and developed a recipe for vegetable soup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dwight D. Eisenhower

questions.question: In which year did Ariel Sharon return to the Israel Defence Forces after his retirement?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1973

questions.question: Which of the statements describes most accurately Ariel Sharons education?

options.text: He never attended college of university after high school.
He attended Hebrew University but never graduated.
He got an undergraduate degree from Tel Aviv University and did the rest of his education in the Israel Defence Forces.
He obtained an undergraduate degree from Hebrew University and a degree from Tel Aviv University.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He obtained an undergraduate degree from Hebrew University and a degree from Tel Aviv University.

questions.question: Which US President was fined $20 for speeding with his horse and carriage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses Grant

questions.question: When did Ariel Sharon first fly to Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in 1945

questions.question: Which of the following US Presidents was related to 11 former presidents, either by blood or marriage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: Which US President had 15 children, 8 by his first wife and 7 by his second wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Tyler

questions.question: Ariel Sharon, the 11th Prime Minister of Israel, was born in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1928

questions.question: William Taft was the heaviest president of the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which best describes former Prime Minister Ariel Sharons family life?

options.text: He was married twice and has three sons.
He was married twice, divorced twice and has four sons.
He was married once and has two daughters and two sons.
He was never married but has four adopted sons.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was married twice and has three sons.
